skillTree.localised_description: "These End Times of yours, pffsh, the crops are not even failing that much. When I was young I had to fight off two thousand Arabyans just to get to my hors- WHERE ARE YOU GOING?"
"Be like a spear, and have a point! Ah-ah!"

effects.description:
Melee defence: +8 for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Myrmidia, if not a member outright. Myrmidia is an ascended mortal and the chief deity in the south, and the vast influence of her cults teach tactical acumen, mercy, and civilization.

effects.description: Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of Nahmud, if not a member outright. Although part of the vaster Myrmidian cults, the various sects of Nahmud favour equality and special education, and are somewhat too fond of secrecy.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of Sister Fury, if not a member outright. One of Myrmidia's companions in life, Fury's legacy is one of intense, violent, but controlled rage and violence against injustice and destruction.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Solkan, if not a member outright. The merciless god is one of the most ancient, and just as timeless is his unbridled retribution against the corrupted. His is currently a relatively awkward presence, strongest in Remas.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Morr, if not a member outright. The old god of the dead's legacy is one of fatalism and certainty, and finds its largest seat in Luccini.

effects.description:
Battle healing cap: -10%
	(enemy armies in local region)
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Shallya, if not a member outright. Her teachings of healing and compassion feel at odds with the world's grimness and darkness, which is also why many flock to her.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Verena, if not a member outright. Like her husband Morr, the blind deity's legacy is not only one of learning and justice, but also one of detached impartiality.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Ranald, if not a member outright. He is one of many and sometimes darker aspects, but the lord of fortune was also the only one who could make Morr smile. Somewhat.

ui_effects.localised_text: Grants one of the listed effects at random

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: A commoner was once asked by a foreign recruiter about a band of Estalian mercenaries. Shrugging, he replied that they were "evil men", which was misunderstood as being 'local' for tough troops. Like many mistranslations, it stuck.

effects.description:
All damage: +10% for Adventurers, Royal Guard, Riders and Lancers (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Adventurers, Royal Guard, Riders and Lancers (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +10% for Adventurers, Royal Guard, Riders and Lancers
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Being able to slow the foe, drain it of energy and the will to fight on, is a mighty power to wield.
Well, this is straightforward enough.

Melee defence: +2 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +2 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Oh wait, there's another chapter.

skillTree.localised_description: Even the lousiest commander knows that you need two halves of a pair of scissors.

Leadership: +2 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +3 for spear, lance and great weapon units

Charge bonus: +10 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Duck! Shoot! Duck! Shoot! Shoot- shoot, that was wrong.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +3% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +6% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +10% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The key is not letting your initiative depend on a lucky die.
It's seldom enough to have only some of your troops to be ready to take a beating. The enemy has their own plans.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +3% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +3 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Chaos Worshippers and mutants are anathema to everything sacred. Cutting them to ribbons is the first step towards purity.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +6 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Norsca and Beastmen
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The old Sunscryer trusts the fellow human so very marginally more than he trusts the other races, and any common ground only propels his paranoia. Something about their foreigner habits and their filthy lingo.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 when fighting against Humans
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 when fighting against Humans
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Unbeknownst to him, Sokth's curse pervading what is left of his body is only becoming stronger, more vengeful and contagious. Eventually, it will put an end to Eustaquio's unlife, but until then it's only corroborating his belief in a blessing of the gods.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
A commander that allows his captains and troops to everything they can put their hands on is either irresponsible, well-adviced, criminally aggressive or all of the above.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.
It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

items.colour_text: The best smiths were called to restore Eustaquio's plate armour. However, he wouldn't let anyone replace the chest piece or repair the hole through which the Nehekharans ripped out his heart.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -8
	(local region)

items.colour_text: The weapon is an old gift from the Black Guard to the then-High Eagle of Myrmidia, and later made its way to Eustaquio. It is excruciatingly sharp and smells faintly of rotting roses. No matter what, Eustaquio seems to be viciously gripping it like a life-line.

effects.description:
Attribute: Immune to Psychology when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Eustaquio's presence at the lead of an army has an understandably perplexing effect on the troops, except on the most travelled of them. Some who have taken up odd customs abroad even tried to paint a pair of moustaches on the skull.

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

Recruitment and Upkeep cost: +20% for Knights of the Righteous Spear and Sisters of Fury
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +30% for all gunpowder units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: -10% for all gunpowder units
	(Lord's army)

The Alcatani Fellowship will never fight for this Legendary Lord
	(Lord's army)
